patterns: what is the capital of France
what is the speed of light
what is the formula for acceleration
what is the largest organ in the human body
what is the boiling point of water

what is the diameter of Earth

responses: The answer is 5
The capital of France is Paris
Thomas Edison invented the lightbulb
The speed of light is approximately 299,792 kilometers per second
The formula for acceleration is final velocity minus initial velocity divided by time
The largest organ in the human body is the skin
The boiling point of water is 100 degrees Celsius
Photosynthesis is the process by which green plants and some other organisms use sunlight to synthesize foods with the help of chlorophyll
The average distance to the moon is about 384,400 kilometers
The diameter of Earth is approximately 12,742 kilometers
The atomic number of oxygen is 8
The chemical symbol for gold is Au
Mount Everest is the tallest mountain in the world
The Kansas City Chiefs won the last Super Bowl
The world record for the 100m sprint is 9.58 seconds
There are 5 players on a basketball team

patterns: who won the last FIFA World Cup?
what is the record for most goals scored in a single football match?
how many Grand Slam titles does Roger Federer have?
what is the fastest recorded serve in tennis?
who won the last NBA championship?
what is the highest score ever achieved in an NBA game?
how many Olympic gold medals does Michael Phelps have?
what is the record for the longest home run in MLB history?
who holds the record for the most home runs in a single MLB season?
how many UFC titles has Conor McGregor won?
what is the fastest knockout in UFC history?
who is the current heavyweight boxing champion?
what is the longest winning streak in professional boxing?
how many Olympic gold medals does Usain Bolt have?
what is the world record for the marathon?
responses: France won the last FIFA World Cup in 2018.
The record for most goals scored in a single football match is held by Stephan Stanis with 16 goals.
Roger Federer has won 20 Grand Slam titles.
The fastest recorded serve in tennis was 163.7 mph (263.4 km/h) by Samuel Groth.
The Milwaukee Bucks won the last NBA championship.
The Detroit Pistons and Denver Nuggets jointly hold the record for the highest score in an NBA game with 186 points each.
Michael Phelps has won 23 Olympic gold medals.
The longest home run in MLB history was hit by Mickey Mantle and traveled an estimated distance of 634 feet (193 meters).
Barry Bonds holds the record for the most home runs in a single MLB season with 73 home runs in 2001.
Conor McGregor has won two UFC titles.
The fastest knockout in UFC history is 5 seconds, achieved by Jorge Masvidal against Ben Askren.
The current heavyweight boxing champion is Tyson Fury.
Floyd Mayweather holds the record for the longest winning streak in professional boxing with 50 wins.
Usain Bolt has won 8 Olympic gold medals.
The world record for the marathon is 2:01:39, set by Eliud Kipchoge.
